Data: 2.10pm: George Bailey has followed the lead of Charlotte Edwards, then - the England women kept Australia to 91 in their 20 overs, after winning the toss, and then knocked off the runs. Also instructive may be England's card against South Africa here last year. Put in to bat, they made just 118 and lost b
Johnson to Lumb, no run pitched up full outside off, Lumb plants the front foot and drills the ball straight to the man set slightly back at cover
Johnson to Lumb, no run slightly shorter, punched on the up in front of square, again picks out the fielder
Johnson to Lumb, no run kicking off a length, at the body and Lumb wears it on the thigh pad trying to play across the line
Johnson to Lumb, 1 run short, outside off and pulled, doesn't time it and the ball rolls slowly wide of mid-on
Johnson to Hales, no run decent bumper from Johnson, gets it up above Hales' eyeline, he crouches out of the way
Johnson to Hales, no run speared across, back of a length and there's an energetic appeal as the ball darts past the outside edge - umpire not interested
Watson to Lumb, FOUR runs slightly back of a length and wide of the stumps, Lumb carves the ball through point with a whip-crack slash
Watson to Lumb, 1 run bit of width again, Lumb opens the shoulders and uppercuts over gully, down to third man
Watson to Hales, 1 leg bye on leg stump, short of a length ball deflects away off the pad

Watson to Lumb, FOUR runs sits back and muscles a pull through midwicket, plenty of wood on that but still Warner should have cut it off on the boundary, somehow he slid over it, to the general delight of the crowd
Watson to Lumb, 2 runs clips this one off the pads, behind square and this time Warner fields without mishap
Watson to Lumb, no run touch short, on the stumps, pulled to the man at midwicket
Johnson to Hales, no run fullish-length ball, squirted into the covers from the crease
Johnson to Hales, FOUR runs on the pads, Hales whips across the line and forces the ball to the boundary in front of deep square leg - Hales is off the mark
Johnson to Hales, FOUR runs drops short and this time he just uses the pace to pull round the corner, sends the ball skidding behind square this time
Johnson to Hales, no run better line and length, not quite short enough to pull, played from in front of leg stump back down the track
Johnson to Hales, no run angled across on a length, Hales drives on the back foot, gets an inside edge towards midwicket
Johnson to Hales, 1 run pitched up and driven hard coming forwards, mid-off collects and throws but Hales was home
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run good length, outside off, punched into the covers on the front foot
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run big appeal from Wade as Coulter-Nile beats the outside edge of Hales' bat ... but even the bowler didn't fancy that one
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 1 run on the stumps, worked into the leg side for one

Coulter-Nile to Lumb, FOUR runs Lumb hoicks a length ball on the pads h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h into the leg side, Glenn Maxwell does tremendously to get anywhere near it out at deep midwicket but misjudges the descent and dives past it as it bounces and then trickles over the rope
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, no run length outside off, pushed square on the off side
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, no run goes round the wicket, angled in and holding its line, nips past the outside edge
Faulkner to Hales, FOUR runs inside-edged past the stumps! Hales gets away with one, a Chinese cut that was a whisker from hitting the stumps, wrong-footed Wade and scuttled for four
Faulkner to Hales, FOUR runs another boundary, Hales swatting across the line and getting far more edge than middle on it, the ball races to fine leg
Faulkner to Hales, no run good length, pushed across and steered with an open face to backward point

Faulkner to Hales, SIX runs well, he's genuinely got hold of that one ... clears the front foot, hits through the line and deposits Faulkner (not literally) high over long-on for the first six of the match
Faulkner to Hales, FOUR runs closes the face and crunches in front of square, nothing more than a glance really, but it beats the fielder in the deep, despite a good, full-length effort
Faulkner to Hales, 1 run on the pads, gets a thin edge and they pick up one to midwicket, despite a moment's hesitation
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs dug in short, swings hard across the line and top-edged over the keeper for four. Hard to stop those!
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run fuller length and punched into the off side
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 1 run short and outside off, stays back and gets on top of a drive towards point, who is set back and they get one
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, FOUR runs this is dismissive stuff, walking down the wicket and clubbing a length ball over mid-on, just clears the man and skids away

Coulter-Nile to Lumb, FOUR runs another malevolent swipe across the line from Lumb, such a strong batsmen and he flicks a length ball forcefully off his pads in front of deep midwicket for consecutive boundaries
Coulter-Nile to Lumb, 2 runs slightly short outside off, drops back and steers a couple through point
Watson to Hales, 2 runs punched down the ground, towards long-on but he has to come in and they get two
Watson to Hales, 1 run outside off, goes back and opens the face for a single behind point
Watson to Lumb, SIX runs mind the windows! Me oh my, that's gone a long way, right in the slot and brutalised over long-on by Lumb. He's had his Weetabix this morning
Watson to Lumb, 1 run full again but wider this time and carved over cover to the sweeper
Watson to Hales, 1 run gets the full-bunger in, dug out behind square on the off side
Watson to Lumb, 2 runs skips forward, opens the shoulders and drills through the covers, beats the man on the ring for a couple more
Fawad to Hales, no run tossed up and pushed into the off side
Fawad to Hales, FOUR runs floated up wide of off stump, lovely stroke from Hales, opening the face to guide the ball through backward point to the boundary
Fawad to Hales, 1 run length ball, straightening on leg stump, tucked through square

Fawad to Lumb, no run looped up on leg stump, Lumb sweeps across the line and it hits the boot, bounces high into the leg side where Wade catches it - there's an appeal but no bat or glove adjudged to be involved
Fawad to Lumb, 1 leg bye legbreak, skidding towards leg stump, pitched outside though and they pick up one as the ball rolls past Wade
Fawad to Hales, 1 leg bye skidding on towards leg stump, plays across the line, another leg bye
Faulkner to Hales, 1 run clipped off the pads through the leg side
Faulkner to Lumb, 1 run advances and swats a length ball down the ground back past the bowler

Faulkner to Hales, no run very nearly a mix up, and a direct hit from Faulkner would have seen Hales run out by a mile - he had got an inside edge on a pull, maybe taken a blow on the box and stood and watched it as it dropped to the pitch, Lumb had come charging down and Hales had to set off at the
Faulkner to Hales, no run pitched up and driven back, Faulkner gets a hand on it
Faulkner to Hales, FOUR runs slightly overpitched on leg stump and a swingeing leg glance hammers the ball flat to the boundary
Faulkner to Hales, 1 run advances down the track and hacks one to long--off
Fawad to Hales, 2 runs tossed up on leg stump, Hales waits on it and clips a couple through midwicket - that's fifty for Hales, who has had his struggles this season but just drinks in this format
Fawad to Hales, 1 run tossed up outside off, leans out and pushes one through the covers
Fawad to Lumb, 1 run over the wicket to the left-hander, very wide of the stumps, maybe the googly, Lumb gets his foot to the pitch and sweeps behind square
Fawad to Hales, 1 run whips a length ball off his pads to leg
Fawad to Lumb, no run gives this plenty of air, drifting across the lefty, throws the bat and gets an inside edge, Wade does well to stop it with a boot
Fawad to Lumb, 1 run full toss, advances and thumps over Ahmed's head for one to long-off
Johnson to Lumb, 1 run heaved over the leg side, he came down the pitch outside leg and then had to fetch it from outside off
Johnson to Hales, no run swing and a miss at a full delivery going across outside off
Johnson to Hales, SIX runs he's connected with that! Six more. On a length, a cutter, allowed Hales to get underneath it with a clean swing of the bat over long-on
Johnson to Hales, FOUR runs drags the length back even shorter and gets pulled wide of short-fine leg...Johnson neither one thing or the other those last two deliveries
Johnson to Hales, 1 run full outside off, slices this in the air through backward point

Johnson to Lumb, FOUR runs creamed again...Johnson stays full, Lumb just gives himself a hint of room and drills it hard and flat over mid-off. It pitches fractionally before the rope. Fierce power from Lumb.
Fawad to Hales, 1 run full at middle and leg, flicked through midwicket

Fawad to Lumb, OUT first international wicket! Lumb goes for a slog sweep, the ball goes straight up in the air then floats behind the stumps on the breeze. Wade turns, trots back and settles under the catch. Ahmed is on the ledger
Fawad to Hales, 2 runs dragged down a touch short, Hales pulls it through straight midwicket to the right of long-on
Fawad to Hales, 1 run comes forward, drives with an open face through the off side
Fawad to Wright, 1 run floated up outside off, Wright pushes it square through point
Fawad to Hales, 1 run cut off the stumps, another misfield, this time by backward point, although they would probably have got the single anyway
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 1 run big full toss outside off, flies off the top edge to third man as Hales aims more through cover
Coulter-Nile to Wright, 1 run short outside off, flat-bat pulled down to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run beaten outside off as he plays over the top of a full delivery
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs gets another boundary to fine leg, but it was a pin-point yorker from Coulter-Nile which Hales somehow managed to inside edge through his legs
Coulter-Nile to Hales, no run crunches this one back to the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 2 runs this skews off the bottom of the bat as he aims something mighty over the off side, ends up dropped well short of any of the deep fielders
Maxwell to Wright, no run round the wicket, full outside off, driven to cover
Maxwell to Wright, 2 runs down the pitch and whips it through midwicket to the right of long-on where Warner loses his footing and stumbles, much to the amusement of the crowd
Maxwell to Wright, 2 runs another brace into the leg side, placed with good pace through midwicket so the deep man couldn't quite get in fast enough
Maxwell to Wright, 1 run uses his feet again and drilled down to long-off when I think he was aiming leg side
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run tucked off the stumps to deep square
Maxwell to Wright, 1 run flicked through midwicket and this time he's kept to a single...decent over for Australia
Johnson to Wright, no run full at the stumps, driven to mid-on who is inside the circle...Wright just trying to over-hit at the moment
Johnson to Wright, no run back of a length, beats Wright's attempt to play square through the off side
Johnson to Wright, no run excellent over so far, Wright mistimes another pull which hits Johnson in his follow through
Johnson to Wright, 1 run banged in shorter, Wright pulls firmly but straight to deep square-leg
Johnson to Hales, 1 run yorker at off stump, Hales can only squeeze it down to long-off

Johnson to Wright, FOUR runs another one beats the keeper! We've seen a few of them today. Wright gets a bottom edge as he aims an off-side drive to a full delivery and it deflects past a diving Wade to his left
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run speared wide outside off from round the wicket, jabbed to deep cover
Maxwell to Wright, SIX runs he finds the middle this time...down the pitch and strikes through the line, sending it dead-eye straight down the ground
Maxwell to Wright, FOUR runs fired wide outside off again, Wright catches up with it and slices through short third-man...Wright now up and running
Maxwell to Wright, FOUR runs well, did deep midwicket misjudge this? It was a low full toss that Wright clubbed towards the boundary, but it landed inside the rope with the fielder a few yards in
Maxwell to Wright, 1 run driven into the off side
Maxwell to Hales, 2 runs another juicy full toss, swung through the leg side and this time deep midwicket gets around
Faulkner to Wright, 2 runs full at leg stump, flicked in the air through midwicket

Faulkner to Wright, OUT well held! Wright tries to get a low full toss over mid-off, but Johnson times his leap to perfection and holds it two hands, ensuring he doesn't let it spill as he thuds into the ground
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 runs he's away this time, cuts this through backward point and places it wide of third man
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run clubbed down to long-on, lost his shape a little on the shot
Faulkner to Hales, 1 run uses his feet, makes it a full toss, crunched down to long-on
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run gets down on one knee, lap-sweeps this down to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, SIX runs a big 'un as Morgan picks this up from outside off and launches it comfortably over deep midwicket...was on a friendly length from Coulter-Nile
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run driven straight to mid-off...Morgan felt he had to get the dive out
Coulter-Nile to Hales, (no ball) 2 runs bonus for England, this is a no-ball which Hales flicks high in the air to split deep midwicket and long-on
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 2 runs can't really make the most of it, gets another length ball but Hales' bat twists in his hands and the shot lobs between fielders on the off side
Coulter-Nile to Hales, FOUR runs backs to leg and carves this over backward point, wrong length again...into the 90s
Coulter-Nile to Hales, 1 run gets inside the line and pulls but picks out short fine-leg
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 2 runs wide outside off, driven high over the covers but the sweeper is able to cut off the boundary...productive over
Faulkner to Hales, 1 run full outside off, driven to long-off
Faulkner to Morgan, 2 leg byes drifting towards leg stump, he's a little fortunate that it only costs two leg byes...deflects square of the wicket and Wade had to do the chasing
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good delivery, yorker at middle stump, he can't beat midwicket
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run excellent again, speared in towards middle and leg, they scamper one to midwicket this time
Faulkner to Hales, 2 runs missed out, really, on a big full toss as he clubs it straight down the ground for a couple
Faulkner to Hales, OUT still no hundred for England...gets another low full toss which he clouts towards the bottom of the bat and is well taken, low at long-on
Fawad to Buttler, OUT well bowled! lovely delivery from Ahmed, bravely flighted up. It grips and spins past Buttler's prod as he just tried to dab it into the off side
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run swept off leg stump out to deep square
Fawad to Morgan, SIX runs all the way...Morgan connects cleanly with a slog-sweep and that was always heading into the crowd
Fawad to Morgan, OUT gone this time, with a googly, Morgan hits it firmly but without the height or distance and picks out deep midwicket
Fawad to Root, 1 run confidence of youth...reverse sweep first ball but it goes straight to backward point
Fawad to Bopara, no run fired in outside leg, but Bopara has moved so far outside the stumps that when he misses it goes inside his body. Dot ball to finish
Johnson to Lumb, no run pitched up full outside off, Lumb plants the front foot and drills the ball straight to the man set slightly back at cover
Johnson to Lumb, no run slightly shorter, punched on the up in front of square, again picks out the fielder
Johnson to Lumb, no run kicking off a length, at the body and Lumb wears it on the thigh pad trying to play across the line
Johnson to Lumb, 1 run short, outside off and pulled, doesn't time it and the ball rolls slowly wide of mid-on

Fawad to Buttler, OUT well bowled! lovely delivery from Ahmed, bravely flighted up. It grips and spins past Buttler's prod as he just tried to dab it into the off side
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run swept off leg stump out to deep square
Fawad to Morgan, SIX runs all the way...Morgan connects cleanly with a slog-sweep and that was always heading into the crowd
Fawad to Morgan, OUT gone this time, with a googly, Morgan hits it firmly but without the height or distance and picks out deep midwicket
Fawad to Root, 1 run confidence of youth...reverse sweep first ball but it goes straight to backward point
Fawad to Bopara, no run fired in outside leg, but Bopara has moved so far outside the stumps that when he misses it goes inside his body. Dot ball to finish

Australia have managed to keep England under 200. Good last over from Ahmed. But England played well. Hales and Lumb laid the platform with a hundred stand. So, can Finch knock these off? Join Alan in a few minutes to find out.

Hello everyone. A decent total from England, though, with Aaron Finch in their rearview mirror, they won't be too comfortable - and he doesn't need any help in looking big. However, Australia have only once chased anything like this total, during Mike Hussey's match against Pakistan in the 2010 World Twen
Steven Finn is going to open to David Warner again
Finn to Warner, 1 run leg side, on a length and tucked through square off the pads
Finn to Finch, 1 leg bye slightly back of a length, works off the pad and it roll behind square, no bat involved
Finn to Warner, no run length, tight line on the stumps, Warner blocks back towards mid-on
Finn to Warner, 1 run fuller, around middle and off stump, gets forward and pushes fine of mid-off for one
Finn to Finch, no run Finn pummels the ball into the pitch short and fast and it climbs past Finch's nose as he swings and misses
Finn to Finch, 1 run touch short of a length, angling back in off the pitch, prodded back on the off side for another single
Broad to Finch, FOUR runs pitched up outside off, not a half-volley but hit cleanly on the up over mid-off for four

Broad to Finch, OUT swats across the line, top-edged and the ball loops tamely to mid-on! England have slain the beast! Everyone was expecting him to go after the bowlers again and Finch is always going to live and die by the sword. Although it was more like the pen knife this time... Maybe not quit
Broad to Watson, no run gets across and defends a length ball on the stumps
Broad to Watson, 1 run gets forward and steers one through the off side
Broad to Warner, no run good length, around middle and off, Warner covers up in defence
Broad to Warner, no run again Warner goes back and across and respectfully blocks from the crease
Finn to Watson, 2 runs length ball outside off, comes forward and drives away from the body through a gap in front of point for a couple
Finn to Watson, no run touch fuller, steps outside off and drives to mid-off
Finn to Watson, FOUR runs little bit short from Finn and Watson comes hard at him, swatting a top-spin forehand over mid-on, lovely clean hitting from Watto

Finn to Watson, OUT superb bit fielding from Morgan, a direct hit from backward point and Watson is gone for all money! He was sent back by Warner, never a run there, but Watson turned like a HGV backing up to a petrol pump, dived for the crease but Morgan's throw was on target, bouncing and shatter
Finn to Marsh, no run ooh, jaffa first up from Finn to Marsh, seaming and bouncing past the outside edge as the batsman poked at it
Finn to Marsh, no run beaten again, another snorter and rises sharply just outside off, Marsh helpless
Broad to Warner, FOUR runs Warner isn't going to take this reclining and he advances to bosh a cross-batted swipe past mid-on for his first boundary
Broad to Warner, no run bit of width, stays back and cuts a length ball into the ground to point
Broad to Warner, FOUR runs short and wide again, gets this away behind square with a vicious thrash of the hands, excellent bat speed and the ball flies to the boundary
Broad to Warner, no run Broad continues to bowl wide of the stumps, Warner clatters the ball to point again
Broad to Warner, 1 run fires it wide of the off again, steered through backward point, third man covers it
Broad to Marsh, no run three balls to Marsh outside off, three times it has zipped through and into the keeper's gloves
Finn to Warner, SIX runs we do know what Warner can do and, even he didn't, so does Finn, as a length ball outside off is launched over long-off, one step and a flowing swing of the bat
Finn to Warner, no run better length from Finn, steps away and pats into the covers
Finn to Warner, 1 run tries to make room again, hacks across the line and gets one wide of mid-on
Finn to Marsh, 1 wide short and rising down the leg side, that's a wide
Finn to Marsh, 1 run stays back of a length, on the pads and nudge in front of square leg
Finn to Warner, no run Warner dances out, tries to put Finn into orbit, throws the bat but fails to connect as it flies across him
Finn to Warner, 1 leg bye back of a length, on the pads and it rolls away off the hip as Warner tries to glance
Dernbach to Warner, no run length ball, pushes back and it's wide of Dernbach before landing safely on the cut strip
Dernbach to Warner, SIX runs sixer, over long-on! Too full and in the whacking zone from Dernbach, Warner seized on it and boinged the ball over the rope
Dernbach to Warner, no run pushed across, played into the off side
Dernbach to Warner, 1 wide fiery bouncer, soars through as Warner attempts to uppercut and misses - called on height, though
Dernbach to Warner, no run slightly back of a length, worked to midwicket
Dernbach to Warner, no run length ball on middle and off, tries to hit on the up but can't get it through the covers
Dernbach to Warner, 1 run on the stumps, drops back and tucks one through square leg
Briggs to Warner, 1 wide drags this down the leg side
Briggs to Warner, no run pushed through on leg stump, worked short on the leg side
Briggs to Warner, FOUR runs gets forward and lofts a full ball over mid-on, bounces but wide of the fielder and reaches the rope
Briggs to Warner, no run gets away with a long hop that Warner drags into the ground
Briggs to Warner, FOUR runs skips out and throws the hands through a rasping drive that beats the man at cover - four more
Briggs to Warner, SIX runs smashed! Warner advances and slogs with impunity, there's a man at long-on but even Morgan on his tip-toes can't grab that one - six!
Briggs to Warner, no run flatter and quicker and Warner gets hit on the body as he comes forward again
Root to Marsh, 2 runs stays back and thrashes a couple through the covers from the crease
Root to Marsh, 1 run skidding on, tapped off the legs for a single through square
Root to Warner, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, paddled through backward square to the man on the fence
Root to Marsh, 1 run turned off the legs through midwicket
Root to Warner, FOUR runs lovely late cut from Warner, sitting back for to chop a slightly short ball behind point, Lumb makes a dive on the rope but the ball spins back and goes for four
Root to Warner, no run short and skidding on, Warner cuts hard but gets a bottom edge, bounces up over the stumps and Buttler collects
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run outside off, length ball and pushed through the covers to the sweeper
Bopara to Warner, 1 wide slower ball, down the leg side - wide
Bopara to Warner, 1 run slightly short, on the stumps, Warner was coming forward and nudges it into a gap at midwicket
Bopara to Marsh, 1 wide back of the hand again, taking the pace off, wide of the tramlines as Marsh thinks about cutting
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run pulls across the line and gets one through backward square
Bopara to Warner, no run slower ball on the stumps, Warner can only pat it into the covers
Bopara to Warner, 2 runs length, worked off the pads through midwicket, the man comes in off the fence and they get two
Bopara to Warner, no run sliding down the leg side, clipped firmly but straight to the man at 45
Root to Marsh, 1 leg bye pushed down the leg side, runs away off the pad
Root to Warner, 1 wide flat and drifting behind Warner - another wide
Root to Warner, 1 leg bye skidding on with the arm and Warner is struck on the pads in front of leg stump, Root appeals but probably sliding past
Root to Marsh, no run plays across the pad and misses
Root to Marsh, SIX runs nailed this one, down on one knee and heaved out towards deep midwicket, signs of aggression from Marsh
Root to Marsh, no run flat and on the stumps, played from the crease into the covers
Broad to Warner, 1 run short of a length, Warner stands on leg stump and unleashes his forearms to power this out to deep cover
Broad to Bailey, no run full at off stump, defended to cover
Broad to Bailey, no run a hint of swing into Bailey who clips it from off stump to midwicket
Broad to Bailey, FOUR runs that's a cracker...after two dot balls he drives a floaty, full delivery straight down the ground
Broad to Bailey, 2 runs Broad responds by going short, Bailey cloths it down to fine leg with a pull and the lack of pace on the shot allows him back for a second
Broad to Bailey, SIX runs he's not hang around, picks up a length delivery and flicks it well over the deep midwicket rope...went with the wind, which helped it carry miles
Root to Warner, 1 run driven through the covers, they think of a second but the throw from Wright at long-off is already on its way it
Root to Bailey, 2 runs stays round the wicket, short of a length, flicked off the back foot through midwicket and they hurtle between the sticks
Root to Bailey, 2 runs worked off the stumps again, this time squarer and again it's placed perfectly for a second
Root to Bailey, 1 run on leg stump, worked straight to deep square
Root to Warner, 1 run onto the back foot, tucked through midwicket and that takes him to fifty off 38 balls

Root to Bailey, 2 runs more deft placement, and quick runner, as Bailey places it through midwicket...Root tries to chase it down but neither he nor long-on can prevent the second. The run out is check - Buttler flicked the ball into the stumps - but Warner was well home
Dernbach to Warner, 1 wide short ball down the leg side, Dernbach had adjusted to see Warner move around his crease but it's still called
Dernbach to Warner, 1 run slower ball, 70mph, outside off, driven out to deep cover
Dernbach to Bailey, 2 runs doesn't quite middle this as he goes over extra cover to a length delivery but it falls well short of deep cover
Dernbach to Bailey, 1 run dragged down short and wide but it only costs a single as Bailey toe-ends it out to deep cover
Dernbach to Warner, no run sharp bouncer this time, 86mph, and it beats Warner's fierce attempt at a hook...close to a wide, actially

Dernbach to Warner, 2 runs oh dear, Finn has made a mess of this at long-off! Warner sent a length delivery miles into the air - there's a tricky wind today - Finn called early but never looked confident and in the end was nowhere near it. Root, a better fielder, was the other man close by
Briggs to Bailey, 1 run drifts into leg stump, flicked to deep square
Briggs to Maxwell, no run full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 run goes for the reverse sweep, it's a straight delivery, gets a bottom edge to short third-man
Briggs to Wade, 1 run stays round the wicket, worked from off stump through the leg side
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 run uses his feet and crunches this down to long-off...reached the fielder in a split second. Still only worth one, mind
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run back of a length, Maxwell aims to the leg side but the ball ends up down at long-off
Bopara to Wade, 2 runs round the wicket, back of a length, bunted down to long-on and they get their skates on between the stumps
Bopara to Wade, 1 run well bowled, another slower ball, 64mph, and it almost provides a return catch as it loops off a leading edge when Wade is through his shot early
Bopara to Maxwell, 2 runs short, wide and fairly slow...the lack of pace means it's hard work for the batsman to swing it through midwicket
Bopara to Maxwell, 2 runs gets a bit more behind this pull through midwicket
Bopara to Maxwell, no run slower ball to end the over, 66mph, and Maxwell is through his shot, getting a bottom edge into his pads
Briggs to Faulkner, 1 run full at the stumps, driven down the ground
Briggs to Maxwell, 1 run steps to leg and hammers this through the off side...finds long off
Briggs to Faulkner, FOUR runs lovely shot, a more controlled version of what Maxwell was trying, moves outside leg stump then goes inside-out over cover
Briggs to Faulkner, no run quicker ball, Faulkner cuts it hard but picks out backward point
Briggs to Faulkner, no run well bowled by Briggs, cramps Faulkner for room as it comes in with the arm and he can only push it back to the bowler
Bopara to Maxwell, SIX runs dropped in short and Maxwell helps himself to a full count over deep square-leg
Bopara to Maxwell, 2 runs this is a touch fuller, but Maxwell still pulls - and almost swings himself off his feet - this time through midwicket
Bopara to Maxwell, FOUR runs that is plastered through the off side, short of a length and it sat up for Maxwell who moved to leg and slammed it over cover
Bopara to Maxwell, 2 runs now he flat-bat pulls this straight down the ground, Finn does well to get around from long-on and hands the ball to Morgan who hurls it back
Bopara to Maxwell, FOUR runs this time Finn gets beaten, good over for Australia, Maxwell picks up a length delivery and lofts it straight down the ground
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run low full toss, Bopara lucky it only costs a single as Maxwell pings it to deep square leg
Dernbach to Maxwell, no run beaten first up, basically he missed his drive at a length delivery

Dernbach to Faulkner, OUT what a catch! Superb from Morgan at backward point. It was a very sharp bouncer, Faulkner was in a horrid tangle as he tried to pull. Comes off the shoulder of the bat and it appeared it would fly just over Morgan, but he turned then pulled out a big leap to hold the catch
Dernbach to Johnson, 1 run full, outside off, driven powerfully out to deep cover...perhaps not the best ball on a hat-trick
Dernbach to Coulter-Nile, 1 run short again, angled into the body, 88mph, pulled down to long leg
Dernbach to Johnson, no run full, wide, swing and a miss...an over that sealed the match from Dernbach

Finn to Coulter-Nile, SIX runs blimey, that's big! Finn offers up a length delivery and Coulter-Nile reminds everyone he can clear the ropes as he launches over deep midwicket. Wasn't even out of the middle!
Finn to Coulter-Nile, SIX runs back-to-back sixes! Is this game still on? Short this time from Finn and he pulls it over the long-leg boundary
Finn to Coulter-Nile, no run that's brave...sends down a slower ball, back of a length, and it beats Coulter-Nile as he aims another pull
Finn to Coulter-Nile, no run quicker this time, 87mph, and it's back-of-a-length again which beats Coulter-Nile for pace
Finn to Johnson, no run round the wicket, another slower ball, and Johnson only finds fresh air as he tries to carve it through the off side
Dernbach to Fawad, 1 run short at the body, fended away backward of square
Dernbach to Johnson, 1 run a full slower ball, it pings out of the middle of Johnson's bat but straight to long-on
Dernbach to Fawad, no run he doesn't seem to keen to stay in line, gets a quick short delivery and is comprehensively beaten
Dernbach to Fawad, (no ball) 1 run high full toss, called no-ball for over waist height so the catch at backward point won't count...Ahmed sliced it high into the off side. Well above waist height
Dernbach to Johnson, 1 run a yorker is dug out into the off side
Dernbach to Fawad, no run banged in short again, Ahmed aims over midwicket but is beaten
Dernbach to Fawad, 1 run slower ball to end with gets chipped into the leg side
Finn to Warner, 1 run leg side, on a length and tucked through square off the pads
Finn to Finch, 1 leg bye slightly back of a length, works off the pad and it roll behind square, no bat involved

That just about wraps things up from today. We now move into ODI action; England travel to Ireland and Australia head up to Scotland with both those matches on Tuesday. England and Australia will then lock horns in five ODIs starting next Friday. We'll bring you all the action as always. For now, though,

England win by 27 runs and it was a very efficient all-round display. Batted powerfully, mostly bowled with verve and the fielding was solid. That means the series is shared 1-1. I really wish these one-day legs of tours were three matches of each length (20 and 50) because often these T20 series are draw
